meanings.definition: The distance between the tips of a bird's wings when fully extended.
meanings.sent1: The wingspreads of the eagle were truly impressive.
meanings.sent2: The wingspreads of the airplane allowed it to glide smoothly through the sky.
meanings.sent3: The penguin tried to match the wingspreads of the albatross but ended up waddling comically.
meanings.sent4: Her dreams had wingspreads that reached the farthest corners of her imagination.
meanings.sent5: The wingspreads of the dragon in the story were described as vast and majestic.

meanings.definition: The extent or reach of something, especially in terms of width or breadth.
meanings.sent1: The wingspreads of the bridge spanned the entire river.
meanings.sent2: The wingspreads of the tree provided ample shade on hot days.
meanings.sent3: The wingspreads of the rumor grew wider and wider until everyone knew.
meanings.sent4: His influence had wingspreads that touched every corner of the community.
meanings.sent5: The wingspreads of her knowledge covered a vast array of subjects.
